beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Tour Divide? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Tour Divide scored 94 out of 100. The Icons tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Tour Divide. Banff, Alberta to Antelope Wells, New Mexico. 2745 mi. A 2.7 thousand-mile expedition along the Continental Divide from Canada to Mexico. The route passes through 5 US states and 2 Canadian provinces, crossing the Divide 30+ times. Terrain ranges from glaciated Canadian Rockies to Wyoming's Red Desert to Colorado's 11 thousand+ foot passes to New Mexico's rocky Gila Wilderness. Surface is roughly 90% unpaved. mostly gravel and forest service roads with some singletrack and paved connectors. The character changes daily as you ride south through changing ecosystems, elevations, and climates.
beats.text_on_screen: Tour Divide | Banff, Alberta to Antelope Wells, New Mexico | 2745 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

strengths: The definitive ultra-endurance bikepacking race—nothing else compares
Spectacular terrain variety: Canadian Rockies to New Mexico desert
Pure amateur ethos—no commercialization, just adventure
Legendary community and lifetime achievement upon finishing

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.narration: What they don't put on the website.
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?'

weaknesses: 47-60% DNF rate reflects genuine brutality—not for the underprepared
2-4 week time commitment excludes most working athletes
Equipment failures across 2,700 miles require bike mechanic skills
Mental challenge may exceed physical—isolation and sleep deprivation compound

beats.label: LOGISTICS

broll_sources.query: Banff, Alberta to Antelope Wells, New Mexico travel guide

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: YYC - 90min to Banff start; ELP - 85 miles from Antelope Wells finish; alternative Columbus NM finish has services
Lodging: Banff for pre-race. During race: bivvy/wild camping saves time vs hotels. Resort towns expensive. Fernie hostel good value. Towns every 100-200 miles for resupply.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: The Ultimate. Yes if you have serious ultra-endurance experience and can commit 2-4 weeks to the Continental Divide. Yes if you can handle complete self-sufficiency across remote terrain. Yes if you want the ultimate test. Skip if you haven't completed multi-day self-supported events. Skip if you need race organization, aid stations, or support crews. Skip if you cannot repair your own bike.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
